page.title: 04MELSONBY-The Allotments Ass.
page.content: For many years, some of the villagers who had either no gardens or only small plots of land near to their homes, rented {allotments}on privately owned land along the{West side of Moor {Road.}In{1944,}these allotment holders begun the{Village Produce Association. When this land was later required for the building of council houses, an alternative site nearby was bought by the{District Council,}divided into{17 {plots}each measuring {9m X 30m}( with grass paths and 'cart roads' to separate them) and let to residents. The {current rent} is {Â£7 per year per allotment including water charges. The name was later changed to{Melsonby {Allotments Ass'n} and every year since 1945 has held an annual produce show, this year being the 41st. such show. The various classes are for vegetables flowers,handicrafts,baking & produce.
